replies.msg: ä¸€äººä¸€ç²’ æ‰“å’Œ Superï¼

Jose Mourinho even managed to get on the wrong side of David De Gea during his time as Manchester United boss.

The Portuguese had plenty of fallouts with his players while at Old Trafford, most notably with Paul Pogba in training.


But it’s hard to imagine how or why he would get on the wrong side of De Gea who won United‘s player of the year at the end of the Portuguese’s second season.

According to The Times , Mourinho‘s public joke at those very awards this year did not go down well with the keeper and his team-mates.

After picking up the Sir Matt Busby accolade, Mourinho said: ”David deserves a third award… he’s the worst player in training…when it’s cold and wet he doesn’t save much in training.“

However, the Portuguese’s joke went down like a lead balloon. It is understood that De Gea and some of United‘s stars thought the remark was crass given that the awards were being broadcast live on TV.

Had the United boss made the joke in training it probably would have been fine, instead nervous laughter and anger followed.

“Alexis [Sanchez] has trained this week so hopefully he will be available for me and for the squad. replies.msg:
Wayne Rooney says Man Utd should do all they can to secure Spurs boss Mauricio Pochettino as their next manager.

"First of all you have to give Ole an opportunity and that's a discussion that has to take place with the Glazers," said Rooney told ESPN.

"But if I had the opportunity to appoint someone, I'd go all out for Pochettino.

"I think Manchester United - certainly over the last 20, 30 years, since Alex Ferguson - have based themselves on youth players, young players, bringing players through.

"I think [Pochettino] gets the best out of his players whether they are younger or older.

"You see some of the young players he has brought through at Tottenham, at Southampton that have gone on to play for the national team, so I think he ticks every box in terms of his quality as a coach, but also his willingness to give youth a chance."
